com.rcsexample.basnlib

Class PacketDecoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rcsexample.basnlib.PacketDecoder

  • public class PacketDecoder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to cut a FIFO of raw bytes into frames, that become Packets. Instantiate only one object of this class.

    Use this class like this:

    1. Implement the PacketDecoder.OnPacketDecodedListener interface methods.
    2. Instantiate one object of this class, and keep a reference to it in your class.
    3. Register as a listener to the object using registerListener(OnPacketDecodedListener).
    4. When you received bytes that you want to decode (for example, from a bluetooth connection), pass them to the PacketDecoder object using the addBytesToQueue(ArrayList) method.
    5. To actually start decoding these bytes (it happens in a parallel thread to keep you UI responsive), call triggerDecoding().
    6. When the decoding is done, you will get the resulting Packets via the PacketDecoder.OnPacketDecodedListener.onNewPacketDecoded(Packet) callback method.
    Author:
    laurenz

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  PacketDecoder.OnPacketDecodedListener
      Classes that implement this interface and register as a listener (see registerListener(OnPacketDecodedListener)) will be able to receive Packet objects and possible decoding errors with this method.

        Parameters:

      • unregisterListener

        public boolean unregisterListener(PacketDecoder.OnPacketDecodedListener l)

        Parameters:
        the - listener to unregister

      • addBytesToQueue

        public void addBytesToQueue(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Byte> in)
        Add some bytes at the end of the decoding queue.
        Parameters:
        in - An ArrayList<Byte> of the bytes you want decoded

      • triggerDecoding

        public void triggerDecoding()
        This method starts decoding a copy of the incoming queue in a parallel thread. If there is already a decoding thread, a second one won't be started, so make sure you call this method at least every time new data is available in the incoming queue.
